Hello...

  Quite new to using jUnit, and of course, I am trying to use it for 
something other than it's base intended purpose.

  I am implementing software on a platform.  In this case, we take 
data in from many customers and map it to a semi-standard format that 
is stored in a DB in an obfuscated XML format that you access via 
objects already deployed by the platform.

  I do not need to test if I can grab a field, or anything like 
that....what I need to be able to do, is test that when a client 
sends in some data, that it always contains required fields.

  You would think this could be done by testing the input data, but 
that would be very difficult because of the various formats of data 
and the engine that is used to parse that data.  I don't want to test 
if the data is in the stream, I need to test if the data made it to 
the DB.

  So what I'm trying to do is use jUnit and some plugin derivatives 
to access the DB and grab a batch of data and go through 
each "record" and determine if it contains those required fields.  
I have been successful in opening up a DB connection using jUnit++ 
which I think I can persist throughout the test suites.  Where I am 
struggling is how to get my Tests to:

- Grab a batch, and then cycle through the objects related to that 
batch, running every test on each object

- Organizing the TestSuites.  I'm not really sure how to get them to 
properly cascade down.  For example, I have the DB connection, but 
I'm not sure where that should be placed.

Hopefully someone else has had to perform this semi-functional semi-
unit test.  A Testing Suite like this would help tremendously to 
regression test during maintenance efforts.

-Mike
